column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Think Ahead
#Text=No one can see the future , yet we all must make guesses about it in order to make decisions and be better prepared for what comes our way .
#Text=The guesses that we make are n't based on seeing the future , but on our knowledge and past experiences , with a little bit of insight mixed in .
#Text=If you do n't want to be blindsided by the future and want to feel ready for whatever challenges life may throw at you , then you have to become a master at thinking ahead .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Determine what you want to plan or prepare for .
#Text=The future is a big place with many eventualities , but chances are that you want to address a specific situation , problem , or opportunity .
#Text=Define this end to the best of your abilities .
#Text=Use your intuition .
#Text=Not all decisions are rational or carefully analyzed , and intuitive guesses can often be quite powerful .
#Text=What feels right ?
#Text=What do you think will happen ?
#Text=When you use your intuition , you draw upon your experience and knowledge in a different way than when you make a rational analysis .
#Text=Listen to your first instinct .
#Text=Intuition often works best before you 've had time to study any details , so pay attention to it , even if you do not act immediately on it .
#Text=Intuition may clue you in to emotional factors and subtle cues that you might otherwise miss .
#Text=If something feels wrong about a situation or you just do n't like somebody , do n't ignore it , even if you ca n't put your finger on the problem .
#Text=Use intuition as a " lead " rather than as a solution .
#Text=Investigate what might be causing your hunch or gut feeling and dig deeper until you find it .
#Text=Consider what you already know .
#Text=Prior knowledge comes from many places .
#Text=Have you tried something similar before ?
#Text=Do you know how somebody is likely to react ?
#Text=Have you seen something done or could you read about others ' experiences with a situation ?
#Text=Could you ask others ?
#Text=Can you try something out or gather data that might suggest what could happen ?
#Text=Detect your own bias .
#Text=People tend to bias their guesses and actions in certain predictable ways .
#Text=For example , recent events may play a larger role in influencing decisions than they warrant ; or , you may be more likely to believe something just because everyone around you believes it .
#Text=If you think this sort of thing is happening , start looking closely at hard evidence ( like facts and numbers ) and question your own assumptions .
#Text=Consult the list of cognitive biases for common presumptions and biases and see if any apply to you .
#Text=Invent hypothetical situations related to your objective .
#Text=Ask yourself " what if " for various possibilities and imagine possible outcomes , possible courses of events that could result .
#Text=Especially , think about possible consequences of different courses of action .
#Text=Consider the worst-case scenario .
#Text=What is the worst thing that could possibly happen ?
#Text=Evaluate the possible risks .
#Text=Is the worst case something you and others could tolerate ?
#Text=Could you clean up a mess , try again later , apologize , lose a bit of money , or cope with criticism or rejection ?
#Text=Is the worst case something you could plan for , avoid , or mitigate ?
#Text=Is the worst case too risky or too undesirable ?
#Text=How likely is the worst case , and how likely is an undesirable outcome ?
#Text=Consider the best-case scenario .
#Text=What is the best thing that could possibly happen ?
#Text=Evaluate the possible rewards .
#Text=What can you do to bias the outcome towards the best case ?
#Text=Where should you set your goals ?
#Text=How likely is the best case , and how likely is a desirable outcome ?
#Text=Think of possible actions to take .
#Text=If you are trying to think ahead , it is probably because you want to decide how to respond to some situation or need , so think of possible responses .
#Text=Evaluate those actions .
#Text=Based on your experience and knowledge about how such events usually turn out , choose or narrow down which action to take .
#Text=Prepare .
#Text=Whatever you have to get ready , be it people , equipment , facilities , plans , or simply courage , get it ready .
#Text=Writing can be a powerful tool for preparation .
#Text=It helps you remember your plans , and it helps you to see them completely .
#Text=Use a calendar or notebook , checklist , chart , whatever helps you .
#Text=Try it .
#Text=Act according to your forecasts and your plans .
#Text=Then , let life take its course .
#Text=See what happens .
#Text=By taking note of the outcome , you will have more experience and knowledge to draw upon the next time you must make a decision such as this one .
#Text=Adjust .
#Text=As you see what really does transpire , adjust your actions or responses as best as you can .
#Text=You may not have the opportunity to change course after you begin , but you do have the benefit of acquiring new information or results .
#Text=Use them to decide how to modify your actions in the present and in the future .
#Text=Tips
#Text=The best- and worst-case scenarios help you establish a range of likely possibilities and make plans and decisions accordingly .
#Text=Skilled planners are in demand throughout the business world .
#Text=If you get good at thinking ahead , consider making a career of it .
#Text=Inaction is a possible response in many situations , but evaluate its merits and risks , too .
#Text=It can have benefits ( more information may come later or somebody 's involvement could harm his or her reputation ) , but it can also have risks ( missed deadlines or opportunities ) .
#Text=An in-between approach might be to wait for a little while , perhaps just long enough to learn more .
#Text=Practice .
#Text=Even when you 're not the one planning or forecasting , make predictions and watch what happens .
#Text=This process will help you refine your predictions .
#Text=Brainstorm together with others .
#Text=Thinking ahead need not be done solo , and you will have the insights and ideas of everybody you consult .
#Text=Also , ideas often feed other ideas .
#Text=Statistics and probability are mathematical ways of analyzing track records .
#Text=Use them if you need numerical information about how likely an outcome is .
#Text=Be honest with yourself .
#Text=No amount of wishful thinking is going to stop the next natural disaster , but the realistic admission that one might happen could lead you to prepare appropriately .
#Text=Make sure to be relaxed and determined .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do n't get so caught up in thinking ahead that you fail to act .
#Text=Often , the best thing to do is to try something based on your best guess and see whether it works .
#Text=Treat your guesses and plans as just that .
#Text=No one can foresee every eventuality .
